message.content:
Saransk is a city located in the European part of Russia, and it serves as the capital of Mordovia or the Republic of Mordovia. It lies near the southern border between Nizhny Novgorod and Penza provinces. Saransk has an estimated population size of approximately 300,000 people.

The city was founded in 1641 and served as an important fortress during its early days before developing into a trading center for agricultural products like grain, timber, and iron ore. Today, it remains an influential economic hub within its region with thriving industries such as mechanical engineering, chemical production, metalworking processes like casting light alloys coupled with food processing plants that specialize in producing sugar from local beet crops along mega dairy farms.

Saransk gained global attention when it was chosen to be one of the host cities for FIFA World Cup held in Russia back in June-July 2018.
